result.execSummary:
The defendant Paige J Riordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 10/1/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paige J Riordan

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Paige J Riordan in court.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State has complied with victim's rights. 
Defendant has provided proof of treatment to the State. 
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:
Fine: $267.50 
Defendant to pay $25 /month commencing 10/01/22 and each month thereafter until satisfied.  Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.  **Rescheduled due to conflict with the Court's calendar.**

09:45 AM Defendant Paige J Riordan in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for bail/bond hearing to address the warrant issued for a non-appearance.
Defendant had called to schedule the appearance.
Court quashes the warrant and reinstates the bond. 
State places the offer on the record.
Defendant is undergoing AODA treatment necessary for amendment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:27 AM Defendant Paige J Riordan not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
Due to her non-appearance, the Court issues a Branch 2 Only capias and revokes and forfeits bail.
Letter from DHHS verifying treatment status filed by the Defendant.

09:14 AM Defendant Paige J Riordan in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is called for status.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.
Defendant is given a petition for appointment of attorney if she would like to proceed with representation. 
Defendant submitted documents to the court at the last hearing.
Defendant files a treatment letter. 
ADA Thurston to meet with Defendant following the hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:41 AM Defendant Paige J Riordan in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant will proceed without counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Victim A appeared by Zoom and makes statements to the Court regarding this case and Victim A's wishes.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Prior: W225 N3178 Duplainville Rd, Pewaukee, WI 53072
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on April 1st, 2022.
